body:
Comment 3: 
Sorry, didn't mean to be confusing.  What happens is that if the os package sees an
EPIPE error returned by a syscall, it calls os.sigpipe.  os.sigpipe exists on Windows,
and just exits with an error message.  So I was just trying to say that everything
should work OK provided the Windows implementation of epipecheck notices the error
reported by the original bug report.

Of course if the bug report is erroneous then just ignore what I am saying.
